column1: # The core Flight System Time (cFS Time) is the time management service module

column2: The cFS Time shall select the time format
The time format shall use one and only one of the TAI format or the UTC format
The cFS Time may use the big endian byte order
column6: cfe-userguide, section: 1.22.4.6 Specifying Time Tone Byte Order

column2: The cFS Time shall select the tone and data order
The tone and data order shall use one and only one of the data preceding tone order or the data following tone order
column6: cfe-userguide, section: 1.22.4.3 Selecting Tone and Data Ordering

column2: The cFS Time may use the fake tone
column6: cfe-userguide, section: 1.22.4.2 Enabling Fake Tone Signal

column2: The fake tone requires the virtual MET
column6: cfe-userguide, section: 1.22.4.2 Enabling Fake Tone Signal

column2: The fake tone excludes the external time source
column6: cfe-userguide, section: 1.22.4.2 Enabling Fake Tone Signal

column2: The cFS Time shall select the time operation mode
The time operation mode shall use one and only one of the time server or the time client
The cFS Time may use the virtual MET
The time client requires the virtual MET
The cFS Time may use the external time source
The external time source requires the time server
The external time source shall use one and only one of the external time data: MET, GPS or spacecraft time
The cFS Time may select the active tone signal
The fake tone requires the data following tone order
The external time source requires the virtual MET
